com.almasb.fxgl.physics

Class PhysicsComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.ents.AbstractComponent
      • com.almasb.fxgl.physics.PhysicsComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.almasb.ents.Component

    public class PhysicsComponent
extends com.almasb.ents.AbstractComponent
    Adds physics properties to an entity.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

        public void setOnPhysicsInitialized(Runnable code)
        Set a callback to run when this entity has been added to physics world.
        Parameters:

      • setBodyType

        public void setBodyType(org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType type)
        A convenience method to avoid setting body definition if only a change of body type is required.
        Parameters:
        type - body type

      • setLinearVelocity

        public void setLinearVelocity(javafx.geometry.Point2D vector)
        Set linear velocity for a physics entity.

        Use this method to move a physics entity. Please note that the vector x and y are in pixels.

        Parameters:
        vector - x and y in pixels

      • setLinearVelocity

        public void setLinearVelocity(double x,
                              double y)
        Set linear velocity for a physics entity.

        Use this method to move a physics entity. Please note that x and y are in pixels.

        Parameters:
        x - and y in pixels

      • setBodyLinearVelocity

        public void setBodyLinearVelocity(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 vector)
        Set linear velocity for a physics entity.

        Similar to setLinearVelocity(Point2D) but x and y of the argument are in meters.

        Parameters:
        vector - x and y in meters

      • getLinearVelocity

        public javafx.geometry.Point2D getLinearVelocity()
        Returns:
        linear velocity in pixels

      • setAngularVelocity

        public void setAngularVelocity(double velocity)
        Set velocity (angle in deg) at which the entity will rotate per tick.
        Parameters:
        velocity - value in ~ degrees per tick

      • applyLinearImpulse

        public void applyLinearImpulse(javafx.geometry.Point2D impulse,
                               javafx.geometry.Point2D point,
                               boolean wake)
        Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. It also modifies the angular velocity if the point of application is not at the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        impulse - the world impulse vector (in pixel/sec)
        point - the world position of the point of application (in pixel)
        wake - if this impulse should wake up the body

      • applyBodyLinearImpulse

        public void applyBodyLinearImpulse(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 impulse,
                                   org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 point,
                                   boolean wake)
        Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. It also modifies the angular velocity if the point of application is not at the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        impulse - the world impulse vector (in meter/sec)
        point - the world position of the point of application (in meter)
        wake - if this impulse should wake up the body

      • applyForce

        public void applyForce(javafx.geometry.Point2D force,
                       javafx.geometry.Point2D point)
        Apply a force at a world point. If the force is not applied at the center of mass, it will generate a torque and affect the angular velocity. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        force - the world force vector (in pixel/sec)
        point - the world position of the point of application (in pixel)

      • applyBodyForce

        public void applyBodyForce(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 force,
                           org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 point)
        Apply a force at a world point. If the force is not applied at the center of mass, it will generate a torque and affect the angular velocity. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        force - the world force vector (in meter/sec)
        point - the world position of the point of application (in meter)

      • applyForceToCenter

        public void applyForceToCenter(javafx.geometry.Point2D force)
        Apply a force to the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        force - the world force vector (in pixel/sec)

      • applyBodyForceToCenter

        public void applyBodyForceToCenter(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 force)
        Apply a force to the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        force - the world force vector (in meter/sec)

      • applyAngularImpulse

        public void applyAngularImpulse(float impulse)
        Apply an angular impulse.
        Parameters:
        impulse - the angular impulse (in pixel/sec)

      • applyBodyAngularImpulse

        public void applyBodyAngularImpulse(float impulse)
        Apply an angular impulse.
        Parameters:
        impulse - the angular impulse (in meter/sec)

      • applyTorque

        public void applyTorque(float torque)
        Apply a torque. This affects the angular velocity without affecting the linear velocity of the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        torque - the force (in pixel)

      • applyBodyTorque

        public void applyBodyTorque(float torque)
        Apply a torque. This affects the angular velocity without affecting the linear velocity of the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
        Parameters:
        torque - the force (in meter)

      • setRaycastIgnored

        public void setRaycastIgnored(boolean b)
        Set true to make raycast ignore this entity.
        Parameters:
        b - raycast flag

      • isRaycastIgnored

        public boolean isRaycastIgnored()
        Returns:
        true if raycast should ignore this entity, false otherwise
